description: The royal palace of the Ryugu Kingdom on Fish-Man Island, home to King Neptune and his family. A massive structure built from coral and surrounded by large bubble shields.

keyEvents.title: Palace Occupation
keyEvents.description: The Straw Hat Pirates take King Neptune and his guards hostage in the palace, leading to it being labeled as 'occupied' by the crew.
keyEvents.significance: The palace occupation creates the misunderstanding that brands the Straw Hats as criminals on Fish-Man Island.

keyEvents.title: Nami Creates Air with Bubbly Coral
keyEvents.description: Nami uses bubbly coral to fill the palace room with breathable air, saving the crew from suffocation.
keyEvents.significance: Demonstrates the unique properties of Fish-Man Island's coral and Nami's knowledge of the island.

keyEvents.title: Fukaboshi Delivers Jinbe's Message
keyEvents.description: Prince Fukaboshi arrives at the palace to deliver Jinbe's message to the Straw Hats about not fighting Hody Jones.
keyEvents.significance: Sets up the crucial meeting at the Sea Forest where important backstory will be revealed.

statusHistory.reason: Straw Hat Pirates holding King Neptune hostage

description: A heavily fortified tower within Ryugu Palace where Princess Shirahoshi has been confined for ten years to protect her from Vander Decken IX's continuous attacks.

keyEvents.title: Luffy's Harsh Honesty
keyEvents.description: Luffy continues to tell Shirahoshi he doesn't like crybabies while still showing he cares about helping her.
keyEvents.significance: Establishes the unique dynamic between Luffy and Shirahoshi.

keyEvents.title: Neptune Allows Shirahoshi to Leave
keyEvents.description: King Neptune grants permission for Shirahoshi to leave Hard-Shell Tower for the first time in ten years.
keyEvents.significance: A pivotal moment that allows Shirahoshi to finally experience freedom.

keyEvents.title: Shirahoshi Hides Inside Megalo
keyEvents.description: Luffy has Shirahoshi hide inside Megalo the shark's mouth to secretly transport her out.
keyEvents.significance: A creative solution that allows Shirahoshi to leave undetected.

keyEvents.title: Shirahoshi Leaves the Tower
keyEvents.description: Luffy departs from Hard-Shell Tower with Shirahoshi hidden in Megalo, heading to the Sea Forest.
keyEvents.significance: First time Shirahoshi has left the tower in ten years, marking her journey toward freedom.

description: A mysterious underwater forest on Fish-Man Island where sunken ships gather. It serves as the location of Queen Otohime's grave and is where Jinbe waits to meet the Straw Hats.

keyEvents.title: Mentioned as Meeting Place
keyEvents.description: Fukaboshi delivers Jinbe's message that he is waiting at the Sea Forest and the Straw Hats should meet him there instead of fighting Hody Jones.
keyEvents.significance: Establishes the Sea Forest as the location for an important upcoming meeting where crucial backstory will be revealed.

keyEvents.title: Destination for Luffy and Shirahoshi
keyEvents.description: Luffy and Shirahoshi depart toward the Sea Forest so Shirahoshi can visit her mother's grave.
keyEvents.significance: Sets up the convergence of multiple plot threads at this location in upcoming episodes.

description: A popular cafe on Fish-Man Island run by the fortune teller Madame Shyarly, staffed by beautiful mermaids.

keyEvents.title: Chopper's Kung Fu Point Battle
keyEvents.description: Chopper uses his new Kung Fu Point transformation to defend Sanji from Neptune's soldiers at the cafe.
keyEvents.significance: The location where Chopper debuts his new post-timeskip combat form.
